sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post"> <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <category display_value="Tricks">a8c6c0be1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcbef</category> <github_id>61</github_id> <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/61</github_url> <message>If you want to make all the variables of a catalog readonly on RITM or sc_task table, you can use g_form.setVariablesReadOnly(true); Note that this will not work on other tables like incident  https://hi.service-now.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0752560</message> <number>TIL0001060</number> <status>old</status> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-09 13:52:42</sys_created_on> <sys_id>a47e1e251b1dd4d08ed631d7dc4bcb5f</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>3</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-16 17:38:17</sys_updated_on> <title>Make catalog variables readonly</title> </x_0586_til_post> </record_update>
